claims.claim: The observations provide evidence against a strictly airless (bare-rock) interpretation for TRAPPIST-1 b.

evidence.quote: A pure no-atmosphere model cannot simultaneously match both phase amplitude and spectral band behavior.

The dataset provides meaningful evidence against a strictly airless interpretation for TRAPPIST-1 b, but atmospheric composition and pressure remain uncertain enough that follow-up spectroscopy is essential.
Atmosphere-bearing models better explain combined data products

claims.caveat: Retrieval assumptions and remaining degeneracies mean the data do not uniquely identify a single atmospheric composition or pressure.

claims.claim: Non-zero day-night heat redistribution is favored relative to the perfect no-atmosphere limit.

evidence.quote: Heat transport efficiency (epsilon) | 0.19 (+0.23 / -0.14) | 0.0 for perfect no-atmosphere limit | Non-zero redistribution is favored
A non-zero redistribution parameter implies transport beyond an immediate bare-rock reradiation limit.

claims.caveat: Night-side constraints are weaker than day-side constraints, which can limit how tightly redistribution can be inferred.

claims.claim: Spectral structure around 15 um is consistent with CO2-related atmospheric absorption.

evidence.quote: 15 um CO2 spectral band depth estimate | 96 ppm | Flat-spectrum null | Spectral structure is consistent with atmospheric absorption
Spectral structure near 15 um provides composition-sensitive evidence, especially for CO2-rich scenarios.

claims.caveat: Stellar variability and instrument systematics can bias weak spectral features, and composition/cloud degeneracies remain significant.

claims.claim: The planet is constrained to have a low Bond albedo (it appears very dark in fits).

evidence.quote: Bond albedo upper bound | <0.08 | Higher-albedo reflective cases | Planet appears very dark in thermal-energy balance fits
Planet appears very dark in thermal-energy balance fits

claims.caveat: Albedo inferences depend on the thermal energy-balance modeling assumptions used in the retrieval workflow.

claims.claim: A moderate-pressure atmosphere (order 0.3 to 1.0 bar) remains plausible within the CO2-rich retrieval family.

evidence.quote: Preferred pressure scale in CO2-rich retrieval family | 0.3-1.0 bar | Near-vacuum branch | Moderate-pressure atmosphere family remains plausible
Degeneracies between composition, clouds/hazes, and circulation assumptions remain significant.

claims.caveat: Pressure and composition are not uniquely determined; alternative atmosphere cases (e.g., O2-rich) are not fully ruled out.
